channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Israeli military says it is investigating the possible killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar
item.description: Sinwar assumed overall command of the Iran-backed Hamas in August, following the assassination of former political chief Ismail Haniyeh.

item.title: Auto giants launch a flurry of cheaper electric vehicles — taking the fight to China
item.description: Europe's top carmakers unveiled low-cost EVs at the Paris Motor Show this week, seeking to recapture some of the market share held by Chinese brands.

item.title: Nvidia and Apple supplier TSMC shares pop 10% after quarterly profit soars on AI demand
item.description: TSMC, the world’s largest producer of advanced chips, posted a 54% hike in third-quarter profit.

item.title: Retail sales rose 0.4% in September, better than expected; jobless claims dip
item.description: Consumer spending held up in September, underscoring a resilient economy.

item.title: UK regulator warns of big fines, service suspensions for tech giants ahead of new safety rules
item.description: Technology giants could face "significant" fines if they don't comply with the U.K.'s internet safety regulations, the British media regulator Ofcom warned Thursday.

item.title: The solid-state batteries hype is fading – prompting auto giants to consider alternatives
item.description: Despite the hype around solid-state batteries, some analysts believe an alternative could serve as a bridge between these are traditional lithium-ion batteries.

item.title: Uncovering the mysterious side of art pricing. ‘Everyone’s trying to make money’
item.description: Galleries don't always display prices, making the art world mysterious, or possibly even "shady," according to some insiders.

item.title: China pledges more financial support for 'whitelist' real estate projects
item.description: Ni Hong, China's minister of housing and urban-rural development, made the announcement at a press conference on Thursday.

item.title: UK's ultra-rich non-doms urge Italian-style tax regime to prevent wealth exodus
item.description: Britain's ultra-rich non-doms are urging the government to introduce an Italian-style flat-tax regime to prevent a wealth exodus as their preferential status comes under threat in the budget.

item.title: A tough new EU cyber law is off to a messy start, with many countries failing to adopt the rules
item.description: New European Union rules requiring businesses to bolster their cyber defenses are already off to a messy start.

item.title: Intel faces headwinds in China as trade body calls for security probe
item.description: Intel products have been recommended for a security review by a trade group in China which alleges they pose vulnerabilities and risks to national security.

item.title: Overseas UK territories are the ‘biggest enablers of corporate tax abuse,’ tax advocacy group says
item.description: British overseas territories are the world's top enablers of corporate tax abuse, according to a ranking by tax advocacy group Tax Justice Network.

item.title: ASML just gave us a first glimpse into how U.S. chip export curbs will dent its China sales
item.description: ASML on Tuesday offered the first glimpse into how U.S. restrictions on exports of its advanced chip manufacturing tools to China will impact its sales in the Asian country.

item.title: I bought a $54,000 abandoned house in Japan and turned it into a luxury Airbnb—take a look inside
item.description: Anton Wormann, 32, transformed an abandoned house in Japan into a luxury Airbnb stay. Today, it brings in about $11,000 a month.

item.title: Amazon goes nuclear, to invest more than $500 million to develop small modular reactors
item.description: Amazon is the latest large tech company to buy into nuclear power to fuel the growing demands from data centers.

item.title: Global chip stocks fall on ASML's disappointing outlook, possible U.S. export cap
item.description: Global semiconductor stocks dropped, after ASML's third-quarter results pointed to a weaker 2025 sales outlook than the Dutch firm guided previously.

item.title: Morgan Stanley shares pop 7% after beating estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue
item.description: Morgan Stanley has several tail winds in its favor, from high stock values to a rebound in investment banking and strong trading activity.

item.title: Stanley Druckenmiller says he's 'licking my wounds' from selling Nvidia too soon
item.description: In an interview with Bloomberg on Wednesday, billionaire investor Stanley Druckenmiller said selling his Nvidia stock this year was a "big mistake."

item.title: Hong Kong leader announces measures to address housing crisis in annual policy address
item.description: Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee announced a series of measures aimed at addressing the city’s housing affordability crisis during an annual policy address.

item.title: Alibaba's international arm says its new AI translation tool beats Google and ChatGPT
item.description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's international arm on Wednesday launched an updated AI translation tool aimed at merchants that want to sell globally.

item.title: Generative AI startups get 40% of all VC investment in cloud amid ChatGPT buzz
item.description: Venture capital firm Accel says that funding for cloud startups is set to rise 27% in 2024 thanks to a boost from AI — the first year of growth in three years.

item.title: United shares hit pre-pandemic high after airline forecasts strong finish to 2024, plans buyback
item.description: United Airlines said it authorized a $1.5 billion share buyback, its first share repurchase since before the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Bitcoin hits highest level since July, boosting other coins and crypto-related stocks
item.description: The price of bitcoin neared $68,400 on Wednesday, its highest since July, sparking a rally in other cryptocurrencies and related equities.

item.title: Why Big Tech is turning to nuclear to power its energy-intensive AI ambitions
item.description: Large tech firms are turning to alternative power sources like nuclear as a way to fulfill growing energy demands from data centers.

item.title: U.S. crude oil falls below $71 per barrel, continuing sell-off
item.description: Israel reportedly told the U.S. that it will not strike Iran's oil facilities.

item.title: Weekly mortgage demand tanks 17%, after interest rates hit the highest level since August
item.description: Mortgage interest rates rose last week for the third straight week, hitting the highest level since August.

item.title: UK inflation falls sharply to 1.7%, below Bank of England's target for first time in over three years
item.description: Economists polled by Reuters expected the headline rate to come in at 1.9% in its first dip below the Bank of England's 2% target since April 2021.

item.title: Protesters in Spain told tourists to 'go home.' Instead more arrived.
item.description: Tourist arrivals to Spain increased following anti-tourism protests earlier this year. But organizers against mass tourism say the fight is far from over.

item.title: The UAE can guarantee the 'safety and the security’ of U.S.-made chips, G42 CEO says
item.description: The comments come as Washington reportedly continues to weigh limits on advanced chip sales to the Middle East over national security concerns.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Bullish sentiment and broadening rally – markets are in a good place
item.description: Anticipation of rate cuts by the U.S. Federal Reserve and hopes that Beijing will unleash more stimulus to boost its economy are driving up investor sentiment.
